deck: Cerise is a colorist that worked on some of the marsupilami albums.  Woks also a lot with Spirou.  Does most of her job by hand
name: Cerise

deck: Alejandro Germanico Benito Gonzalez, usually known as Xermanico, is an artist whose first job was a Duke Nukem comic.
name: Xermanico

deck: Artist best known for his work in El Jueves magazine. He has also worked in Penthouse, Avui, Dinamo, El Dominical, H Dios O, Mono Gráfico and Titanic.
name: Lluïsot (Lluís Domènech i Alberdi)

deck: Uruguayan artist known for the strip Diógenes y el linyera and his collaborations with magazines like Satiricón and El Jueves.
name: Tabaré Gómez Laborde

deck: Spanish painter, colorist and fireman. He has published works in El Jueves, Totem, TBO, Penthouse...
description:
His style is defined by the use of oil painting. In some occasions, it has caused problems. It takes too long to color one page and some publishers demand the original work, not any scan or similar. Jorge Gomez has replaced various times the oils with acrylic painting. 
 
He combines his work as an artist with his work as a fireman in the town of Murcia.
name: Jorge Gomez

deck: Spanish artist known for his work in El Jueves magazines. He also has worked for Puta Mili and Mister K.
name: Maikel

deck: Real name: José Luis Prats. Known for his work in El Jueves magazine.
name: Ozeluí

deck: Spanish author. He has worked for El Jueves, El Vibora, Makoki, Cairo, Totem and Fluide Glacial among others
description: He starts his career very young. Aged 17, he is already working for the newspaper Regio 7. While studying Fine Arts, he publishes his works in magazines like El Vibora and Totem. He publishes the series Emilo/a in Puta Mili magazine as he works for various fanzines. In 1995 he begins his series La Parejita for El Jueves magazine and wins the Best Script award at Barcelona's Comics Festival. In 1996 he writes A vie de Saint for Fluide Glacial magazine. In 1997 he starts, with Monteys, Para ti que eres joven. He is the director of El Jueves for almost four years, while he publishes through Glenat other works like Mantecatos (Best Comic award at Barcelona's festival) and Rosenda y otros momentos pop. Glenat also publishes Super Puta, an experimental comic. Fontdevila made it using "automatic writing" (or psychography), a technique mainly used by Andre Breton and the surrealist authors in wich the writer lets his thoughts flow without trying to control them. The writing is supposedly produced from a subconscious and/or spiritual source without conscious awareness of the content. In 2006, Fontdevila quits Regio 7, for wich he worked since the beginning of his career, and starts colaborating with the newspaper Publico and El Manglar magazine.
name: Manel Fontdevila

deck: Spanish author known mainly for his work on El Jueves, magazine he directed for almost four years
description: He represents, with Manel Fontdevila, the new generation of El Jueves magazine authors, with his series Tato and Para ti que eres joven. He publishes his first strip in 1989 in Lider magazine. He creates a fanzine called Mondo Lirondo with college friends and wins the Best Fanzine award at Barcelona's Comic Festival. In 1996 he presents Calavera Lunar for Puta Mili magazine and wins the Best New Author award at Barcelona's festival, he is also nominated for Best Work and Best Script. Ediciones El Jueves asks him to create a series for its magazine and he starts his most famous character, Tato. He enters the board of director of El Jueves. Together with Manel Fotdevila, he incorporates new authors to the magazine and starts the series Para ti que eres joven. He becomes the director of El Jueves in 2006 and has to face a judicial sentence for a cover in wich the Prince of Spain appears having sex with his wife "doggystyle". He has also made some series for children in catalan magazines and continued his series Calavera Lunar for a galician magazine.
name: Albert Monteys

deck: Truly inseparable duo known for their daily strip in El Mundo newspaper and their works in El Jueves magazine.
description: Angel Rodriguez Idigoras (Idigoras) was born in 1962, Francisco Javier Rodriguez Idigoras (Pachi), in 1969. They started their careers separately, publishing some works in newspapers of Malaga, their home town. Now, it is truly difficult to know who is who and who does exactly what in their comic strips. They produce a daily strip for spanish newspaper El Mundo for years. In El Jueves magazine, they have published three series. Pascual, mayordomo real (Pascual, Real Butler) and Alicia, institutriz de Letizia (Alicia, governess of Letizia) are a parody of the spanish Royal family (Letizia is married with the prince). The third one is called El perro de la casa blanca (The dog from the White House) and is a parody of US politics.
name: Idigoras y Pachi

deck: Argentinian illustrator and comic books author.
name: Dario Adanti

deck: Argentinian comedian and comic books author.
name: Eduardo Maicas

deck: The number 2. creator of Moomin, and brother of Tove Jansson. He drew and plotted most of the old Moomin adventures.
description:
Works

 
When Tove Jansson stopped making Moomin-stories, his brother took over the series. He made 51of the 73 Moomin-stories himself (with Tove sometimes helping with the script), and 7 of them with Tove. He also wrote a few novels, but they aren`t comics, so nothing else about that.
name: Lars Jansson

deck: Novelist who had done some comic work for DC Comics including La Pacifica and an upcoming Vertigo book.
name: Joel Rose

deck: Author and Novelist perhaps best known for his book It's Superman. Has also written comics such as Green Candles for Paradox Press (DC Comics).
name: Tom DeHaven

deck: Writer on Boom Studio's Zombie Tales - The Series #4
name: Chris Morgan

deck: Creator/Writer/Artist of Hyperactive Comics. Created such characters as Crunch Crakerton, Jawbone Grief, Engine Boy, Telescopic Man, Agent Double Danger and The Free War Messiah to name a few. Currently publishes the quarterly book "Hyperactive Comics".
name: Kevin Hill

deck: Mike Butterworth was the writer of the populair comic book The Trigan Empire. He worked for the publisher Fleetway before going freelance.
description: Mike Butterworth started out as an artist having studied at an art college. His first real work in the comic book industry was when he was hired at Fleetway Publications. His art however was rejected at the company but his writing was welcomed. So he changed his career to be a writer. He wrote comics like Billy the Kid and Buffalo Bill, but his real succes came with the Trigan Empire.
name: Mike Butterworth

deck: Cesare Meloncelli is an italian writer
name: Cesare Meloncelli

deck: Italian comics author, Fusco worked for Intrepido and Tex.
name: Fernando Fusco

deck: Bill Wenzel created a wide variety of single panel humor cartoons for numerous publishers from the 1940s through the 1970s.  He is best know for his good-girl art in a myriad of men's magazines.
name: Bill Wenzel

description:
Scott Rogers started his career as an artist at Park Place Studios and worked his way up the ranks to a game designer at Namco, Capcom and Sony Santa Monica studios before going into publishing at THQ. He is also the author of a book on video game design: Level Up! The Guide to Great Video Game Design as well as the creator for Bedbug.

Scott Rogers received two Bachelor of Arts at California State University at Long Beach - Radio, Television and Film production and Fine Arts in 1992. Prior to joining the USC faculty, Scott worked in the video game industry since 1993 as a game designer, artist and creative manager on over 50 unique games. He has authored (and drew!) two critically reviewed books on game design: Level Up! The Guide to Great Game Design (2010) and Swipe This! The Guide to Great Touchscreen Game Design (2012) In addition to teaching part-time at USC, Rogers is also a Disney Imagineer and also wrote one non-Bedbug comic that was published "Red Faction Armageddon".

With his recently release on Bedbug #1, Rogers will continue with the series and introduce new characters as well as his old characters that were seen in the Shooting Star Anthology.
name: Scott Rogers

deck: The Owner/creator of independent company RAK Graphics. Creator of Chakan the forever man.
name: Robert A. Kraus
Darren Shan

deck: Peter de Wit is a Dutch comic book artist and writer. He's best known for his work on the Gilles de Geus comic.
description:
Career

When he was 14 year old he decided he wanted to be a comic book artist. When he was 17 he published his first short comic book strip in a magazine. It wasn't long after that that he started working for Eppo. In 1985 Peter decided to start working with Hanco Kolk and made the comic book Gilles de Geus which became a big hit. In his years he won several Dutch comic book awards, some shared with Hanco Kolk.   

Personal life

Peter is currently married and lives with his children in Amsterdam. He started his own publisher with Hanco Kolk.
name: Peter de Wit

deck: Hanco Kolk is a Dutch comic book artist and writer most famous for his work on the comic book Gilles de Geus and S1ngle.
description:
Career

Hanco Kolk is a Dutch comic book artist and scenarist. He was one of the founders of the comic book artist collective known as Studio Arnhem. After working anonymous on Donald Duck for a while he made the transition to the magazine Eppo. There he went on to draw for multiple comic books but his best known was Gilles de Geus. He won several comic book awards, some shared with others from the industry.
name: Hanco Kolk
Rickey Purdin

description:
Owen Gieni is an artist that has worked on the co-created webcomics Sore Thumbs and WickedPowered. He has also done the art for graphic novels Last Blood and Crow Scare, which have been collected in print.

Owen is currently the artist on Avengelyne.
name: Owen Gieni

deck: Filipino artist who worked for Warren Publishing in the 1970s.
name: Abel Laxamana

description:
Joan Nebot i Alegret was born in Barcelona Spain in 1932. He published under the pseudonym "Nebot" for his work with Warren Publishing in the 1970s. He was a member of the Spanish agency Selecciones Illustradas which enabled many Spanish artists to work for Warren Publishing in the United States.

He is the older brother of artist Josep Nebot.
name: Joan Nebot

deck: Wanga Comics founder, président, writer, colorist and comic-book artist.
name: Anthony Dugenest

deck: Pini "Pinin" Segna is an italian artist and illustrator.
description:
Born in Florence, Pini Segna graduated at the Academy of Fine Arts in 1944. In 1946, he debuted with the Vincenzo Baggioli scripted 'Agente K6', followed by 'Il Giustiziere Mascherato', for the publishing house Nuova Aurora. In the following year, for Editoriale Sportiva, he made 'Penna Azzurra'. From 1948 he worked as an illustrator of 'Saetta' and 'Volpe' stories for Alpe, and as a collaborator of Arc publications like 'Pantera Bionda', 'Tom Mix' and 'Tom Bill'.
In 1949, he began to work for the Albi dell'Intrepido collection. In the early 1950s, he drew series like 'Dix', 'Tornado Bill', 'Carabina Jones' and 'Gim Falco' for Marino Tomasina Editore, and in the late 1950s, he made 'Dick Montana', 'Gill Bart', 'Glory Men', 'Giungla Kid' and 'Dakota'. Between 1965 and 1977, he was mainly active as an illustrator of 'Mandrake', 'L'Uomo Mascherato' and 'Kriminal stories for Editoriale Corno, as well as 'Akim' for Editions Aventures et Voyages. From 1977 to 1982, he illustrated various stories of  'Zagor' for Daim Press.
name: Pini Segna

deck: Decio Canzio is an italian editor and writer.
description:
Decio Canzio wrote stories for Tex Willer, Zagor, Piccolo Ranger, Akim and others.  
He also was editor-in-chief of Sergio Bonelli Editore publishing house for 30 years.
name: Decio Canzio

deck: Francesco Gamba is an italian artist
name: Francesco Gamba

deck: Giuseppe De Nardo is an italian writer, author of some Dylan Dog stories
name: Giuseppe De Nardo

deck: Gui Karyo is a comic book creator.  He worked for Marvel as the President of Publishing and CIO.
name: Gui Karyo

deck: Paul Geerts is a Belgian comic book author most famous for his work on the comic book series Suske & Wiske.
description:
Career

Paul Geerts worked for Studio Vandersteen under the guidance of Willy Vandersteen. He was watched closely by Willy and was ultimately appointed as the new artist and writer for the populair comic book series Suske & Wiske. He did this from 1972 until he retired in 2002.

Personal life

Paul Geerts showed a lot of similarities with Willy Vandersteen's life. He went to the same school and art academy and ultimately worked at his Studio on his comics.
name: Paul Geerts

deck: Michael Dougherty is a comic book creator who has work on scripts like X2, Superman Returns and Trick'r Treat.
name: Michael Dougherty

deck: Elaine Callender is a comic book creator.  She is a Director of Manufacturing for Marvel.
name: Elaine Callender

deck: Anna Lazzarini is an italian illustrator. Since 1996 she worked for Sergio Bonelli Editore
name: Anna Lazzarini
Kyle Ritter
Diana Egea

deck: The drawer and writer of the Cursing hedgehog and other comics, who is also a vegetarian.
description:
Publication history

Paloniemi started making internet comics in the year 2003, when she started to make

Cursing hedgehog

and "Tassutellen"-comic.

The first comic book that was published from her is a "Tassutellen"-album, which she published herself. After this, Finnish version of Cursing hedgehog album was published. It proved to be succesful, and that`s why Sammakko-publisher decided to publish it`s own version of it. There has already been four Cursing hedgehog volumes, and a fifth is to be published in the year 2011.

Some of her blog comics have also been published, in two volumes (En vaan osaa 1 & 2).

An English edition of Cursing hedgehog was published in the year 2011.

Trivia

  • Milla paloniemi has a blog. Unfortunately those who don`t know how to speak finish or write it, wont probably understand a word from it.
  • She`s fond of nature.
  • She`s a vegetarian.
  • She is in a relationship.
name: Milla Paloniemi

deck: Daniele Nicolai is an italian comic writer. It is also known for his pseudonym "N.Danieli"
name: Daniele Nicolai

deck: Michelangelo La Neve is a comic book writer.
name: Michelangelo La Neve

deck: Paolo Morales is a comic artist and writer. He was born in Rome, Italy
